name: 1,4-bis[(trimethylsilyl)ethynyl]benzene
Reason: 1,4-Bis[(trimethylsilyl)ethynyl]benzene has a melting point that is influenced by several structural components. The basic unit for comparison can be ethylene (with a melting point of -169.2°C). The introduction of two ethynyl groups increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point. The trimethylsilyl group (C(C)(C)C) adds rigidity to the structure, estimated at around +10 °C. The benzene ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and rigidity, estimated at around +20 °C. The ethynyl group introduces a significant increase in molecular weight and size, estimated at around +50 °C. The trimethylsilyl group also introduces a rigid structure, estimated at around +10 °C.
